mcqs.question: Are HTML tags case sensitive?
mcqs.explanation: In XHTML, tags are case sensitive and must be lowercase.

mcqs.question: Which version of HTML enforces case sensitivity in tag names?
mcqs.explanation: XHTML is case sensitive and requires all tag names to be in lowercase.

mcqs.question: What will happen if you use uppercase tags in XHTML?
options: They will be converted to lowercase automatically
Browsers may not render the page correctly
Nothing, XHTML is not strict about case
mcqs.explanation: Browsers may not render XHTML documents correctly if tags are not lowercase.

mcqs.question: How does case sensitivity impact custom data attributes (e.g., `data-info`)?

mcqs.question: Which of the following is the best practice for naming HTML tags and attributes?
